project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I installed Jira 4.0 and GreenHopper 4.0.

I am not able to drag and drop card in the planning board so I have investigated why. The ranking field is disabled and I am not able to enable it.

I tried deleting the field and recreating it but it still does not work.
fields.summary: Ranking field is disabled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In Greenhopper, in the Planning View.

I click New card and get the New card window. This contains
Issue Type                       Priority
Summary
Version
Component
Task Size (custom field)
Assignee
Reporter.

I fill it in, including text in Summary, and get an error:

Summary: field is required.

The text has disappeared from Summary.

If I now fill in the Summary again, it accepts the card.

The same thing happens for every card.

I'm using Opera 10 on Windows XP SP3.

This seems to be Opera-specific - doesn't happen in Internet Explorer.

Here's the output from Environment when I attempted to submit through our JIRA (submission failed):

fields.summary: When creating task using New Card in Opera, first attempt always fails saying "Summary: field is required"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It will really beneficial for GH selenium test.
fields.summary: Please add ID for "Create" and "Create and Close" button in "new card" dialog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Add introductory blurb to each bullet point in GreenHopper 101

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the component and version menus, there is a dot at the start of each item. I'm not sure if the dot has some significance, but it means that you can no longer use tab and a keyboard to quickly get to the component that begins with "m" for example.
fields.summary: When adding a new card, user is unable to use keyboard to select component or fix version

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Can I have a user configuration option that determines the units used in the display of times?  At present I see days and fractions of days, but normally I reason in hours. It is irritating to have to remember that 0.12 days is about an hour (I think) all the time.

This option should apply to issues displayed in the boards (Task and chart boards) and should apply to summations as well.
fields.summary: As a general user I would like my duration values to be displayed in hours and not days on all boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Some web work actions have commands that have very generic aliases, such as "Update", "Move" and "Synch" etc.
These aliases have a good chance to clash with the action name or aliases used by other plugins.

These aliases should be given a name specific to the plugin, such as "UpdateGreenHopperDropBoard"...
Alternatively, the bang syntax can be used in place of command aliases, such as "DropBoardAction!update". In this case, there is no need to define aliases for commands. (However, still need to define alias as an empty String; otherwise, a NPE will be thrown when parsing the xml.)
fields.summary: Generic webwork aliases may clash with other plugins

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be able to see open Crucible reviews corresponding to cards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If the component field is required in the transition screen this one causes the clast cast.

Workarround remove the field from the transition screen if possible.

Support case [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-111]
fields.summary: java.lang.String cannot be cast to java.util.List in TaskBoard transition

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Select a shared in the Agile gadget
Results:
Gadget displays correctly but the selected filter is not in the drop down and the first filter is selected. If none it is left to blank.
fields.summary: If a shared filter is used in the CrossProject gadget this one will not appear in the users filter selection

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Shortcut of the "Create and close" clashes with the "dashboard" menu one (Alt+shift d)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to obtain the CSV data for a burndown chart, based upon a metric.

fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to obtain the CSV data of the issue burndown chart.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a GH user I would like to be able to Shift-Select multiple issues in the Planning Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This can be fix by changing the JIRA > Administration > Global Settings > GreenHopper > "Limit GreenHopper Resources" from 0 to any number or "never ask"

This situation should not occure in 4.1

{panel}

 Description  	
   Hi, I have a Jira 4 installation on Linux and have just installed GreenHopper by installing the jira-greenhopper-plugin-4.0-jira40.jar into the $JIRA_HOME/plugins/installed-plugins directory. The Agile menu appears but when selecting any of the options, for example Task Board, I get the following error even though I have extended the memory allocation in the setenv.sh and all looks fine. Does anyone have any ideas? Thanks, Lisa An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Implement something that would track how likely a given release date is by looking historically to predict the accuracy of the estimation.

JIRA has the data:

    * Past accuracy estimates for each project / component / developer
    * Estimates of un-resolved issues
    * Release dates
    * GreenHopper adds the ability to track holidays in the given timeframe
    * Etc.

A chart or table showing the liklihood of hitting the release date is ___%.
fields.summary: Evidence Based Scheduling Feature

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I can't perform a transition on Task Board, it results in
{panel}{color:red}
*Sorry, no transitions were found!*
*Are you meeting all the workflow step conditions?*
*If so you might want to verify your Task Board mapping.*
{color}{panel}

It all works from JIRA interface (I can click "Start progress" workflow transition).

When I:
# copy _jira_ workflow as _jira-copy_
# create new Workflow Scheme
# assign _jira-copy_ to new Workflow Scheme
# assign a project with new Workflow Scheme

everything's OK and transitions work from GreenHopper.

regards
Grzegorz Grzybek
fields.summary: Unable to transition issue within project with no workflow scheme

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It will be really easy to use "new card" button in selenium with ID.
fields.summary: Please add ID for "New card" in planning board page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The context "Sort by" function does not work in the Task Board. 
Changing the selection in the Sort by drop-down menu to Rank, Assignee or any other of the available fields does not change the order of the issues in the Task Board. (It always displays the issues in the same order which doesn't seem to match any of the selectable sort by fields). This works perfectly well in the Planning Board view so the problem seems to be specific to the Task Board. And it doesn't seem to matter which items I select on the view menu (summaries/cards/list and compact/outline).

We have an installation of Jira/GreenHopper 3.13.4/3.8-jira313 were this problem does not exist. We then made a new installation of Jira/GreenHopper 4.0 on a new server and imported the data from the old system and that is when we noticed this problem.

Not sure if this really is a major but for us the Task Board is not very useful if we can't sort it by rank.
fields.summary: Sort by not working in Task board after upgrade to 4.0

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a GH user I would like links to the documentation for the current task/function

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Remaining Hours field does not show up on sub-task level issues on the Task Board when in List view. 

This field displays correctly on top level issues only in Outline view. In Compact view, it does not display.

We were able to display this field on this board with this same view in 3.8

*Workaround*

Put the field in the corner of the cards and this should show up.
fields.summary: Remaining Hours field does not display on sub-tasks on Task Board in List view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h2. Scenario

# Open user preferences of the agile plugin
# Modify #parents from 1 to 10
# press 'save abd apply'
# close session
# reconnect to jira (userid and password are persisted in the browser, so you don't need to login)
# go to agile tool

--> User preferences are reset, #parents == 1
fields.summary: User preferences are not persisted over 2 sessions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: In the Greenhopper configuration, there is a "Ranking fields" section, which claims to "Add the possibility to rank issues". However the table is usually blank the first time a user sees it, and it is not obvious how to proceed: !ghranking.png! Of course the problem is that there are no custom fields of type "Greenhopper Ranking" defined, and the description alludes to this by saying "Only Greenhopper Ranking fields are supported". I think the wording could be improved here, eg. "Only JIRA custom fields of type 'Greenhopper Ranking' will be shown below." Better yet, detect if there are no Greenhopper Ranking fields defined, and display "There are no custom fields of type 'Greenhopper Ranking' defined. Click here to define a new ranking field."
fields.summary: Clarify the ranking fields UI

fields.description:
I have a bunch of filters I have created for myself, when I go to the planning board under the agile tab, select 'project overview', click on the filters checkbox, and then click the 'edit' link, and select a filter on the left hand side that is a private filter, I still see all the same issues as before.

If I then go and edit that filter and share it with everyone, I now see the filtered tasks.

Likewise, if I use a filter that is shared with everyone, and make a copy of that filter that is private (making no other changes), now when I select that filter in the list, it doesn't do anything.
fields.summary: Planning board filter selection only works for filters that are shared with everyone

It can be easily fixed by changing the setting to a fix number or setting it to "never ask"

fields.description:
Previous versions of greenhopper allowed you to collapse subtasks for a single issue on the planning board.  In JIRA 4.0 we added functionality to collapse all subtasks, but removed the functionality to do it on a single task: 

3.8 

!38.jpg! 

Compare with 4.0

!40.jpg!
fields.summary: Option to collapse single subtask is gone in Greenhopper 4.0

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have found it strange that GH shows only the first level child versions for the Project Overview charts.  In particular I use the Value chart by Children frequently but what I want to see is all the descendants that have no children (i.e. leaf versions).  These versions correspond to the time-boxed sprints.  Where as the parents and grand parents correspond to milestones and releases.  

For a good example look at the GH JIRA Release Chart for Project Overview (Value by Children).  There is one child 4.0.  Not too helpful.  I would rather see the velocity/value chart for all the sprints that went into the 4.0 release and others.  The core of the issue is that releases and milestones usually have variable lengths while sprints are time-boxed.  Showing velocity over time sprint by sprint is what agile/scrum is all about.

I'm most concerned with the release charts but the same could be said for the chart board in some respects.
fields.summary: As a GH user, I would like to see value across all leaf versions instead of root child versions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: As a GH user I would like a way to quickly set up GreenHopper for my project using scrum

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
GreenHopper does not support multiple versions and components, in so far as if you select multiple fixVersions or Components GreenHopper will only use the first one selected. In the case of components they are listed alphabetically and so if there are three components selected - cats, dogs, planes - it will only use 'cats'. 

In agile if a task/issues/etc is so broad it covers many components it should be broken down into smaller tasks.
fields.summary: Document component/version assumptions of GreenHopper

fields.description:
As per the description:

If you create a new context and try to order the ranking field in desceding order, it has no effect.

# Add a ranking field to a project
# Create a new context 
# Specify sort on Ranking field and select the DESC option
# The results are always shown in ascending order
fields.summary: When creating a new context and choosing to sort on a Ranking field, the Ascending and Descending options have no effect.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The planning board shows tasks assigned to individual resources (assignee view) for a project (or for a context filter) but I can't see the tasks for all each team member at the same time and the tasks are only those "assigned" without knowing the work state.

I would like a view similar to the Task Board (Outline View)  but with Team resources (assignees) as the headers (like the Issue header with sub-tasks under as in current task board) and the tasks assigned to them (for the selected "version") in the various columns (to-do, in progress, done etc). The Unassigned tasks would appear at the bottom like the current "Other Issues" grouping. The new view might be called the "Resource Task Board" (the current being "Issue Task Board")

In the same way that GH 4 shows the total column "remaining estimate" and the "remaining estimate" for each Issue header (in the current Issue Task Board) then the remaining estimates would be shown for the column and individual resource (for each column).

This view would be very useful for the SM and team to review the resource loadings during the scrums.

While moving cards (summaries or list items) between resources (to re-assign) would be a useful extension it would not be necessary if technically difficult (re-assigning can be done in the card view). In this view moving cards between columns would maintain the current assignment regardless of the user actually moving the card.

The major advantage of this view is in quickly showing the overall resource backlogs and in-progress items
fields.summary: As a scrum master / manager I would like to see (in a task board type view) the assigned backlog and "in-progress" tasks for all sprint resources

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are using JIRA now in a small team (4 or 5 people) with the possibility of expanding it company-wide (which would be 200+).

With the new "starter kit" pricing I decided to evaluate Greenhopper as well. Not sure if we'll use it, but in any case, should we get the 100+ license for JIRA, we are unlikely to want to pay for everyone to use Greenhopper as well, more likely the 25-user option. Most of our users of issue tracking software are very casual, simple users and don't need bells and whistles.

Right now it looks like whatever the license for JIRA (10, 25, 50, 100, 100+), if you buy Greenhopper you have to have the same license. That seems silly, please decouple the licensing so that if most users don't need the extra features, we don't have to pay for them to sit unused.
fields.summary: decouple greenhopper licensing from JIRA licensing

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When dragging a parent task to a version on the planning board you get a pop up asking if you would also like to move all the subtasks. 

A customer would also like it such that if you move a single subtask to a version you get a popup asking if you want to move all the related subtasks and the parent tasks to the new version.
fields.summary: When moving subtasks show a popup asking if the user would like to move the parent tasks and all its subtasks as well

fields.description:
For a particular iteration, there is a difference in the time remaining on the chartboard and the time remaining elsewhere. The data represented in chart board is incorrect. Let me explain it with some details.

Here I am sharing the information about a particular iteration "Iteration 14" of the underlying project.
fields.summary: Burndown chart is showing incorrect data

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: {quote}One suggestion as you finalize your docs - perhaps your Tech Writer could add a simple example of a workflow (flowchart) to illustrate the order in which things need to progress. Essentially, providing a high-level illustration of the demo walk-through you gave us from start to finish on a project or release. Could be a very simple diagram of flowchart positioned as a best practice process. This would be very helpful to new users like us.{quote}
fields.summary: Add best-practice process diagram

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Migrate GH Quick Start Guide to '101 standard'.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When a sprint is created in Greenhopper, the ChartBoard shows all the elements of the sprint on one chart.  This is fine, but if one (or more) tasks in the sprint falls off track, its VERY hard to determine which task is the cause.  

What ChartBoard should offer is an ability to see the overall total (which is what's there now), and to see each individual task separately in its own chart.  As well as the ability to combine which tasks you want see summed together.  


So picture this:

The main summary chart board is on top.
Then under that, is a chart board for EACH individual task in the sprint.
Next to each individual chart board task, there is a check box to include it in the top-level chart board.  
If I tick a box (which is the default for each chart when the page comes us), its included on top.
If I untick a box, that ask is removed from the total on top.  

So if I untick everything, the chartboard on top is empty, and then I can slowly add tasks (by ticking), and see which one is breaking my sprint.

Or something like that.

Thanks
fields.summary: Allow Chart Board to show each task as its own chart.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Stacktrace:
java.lang.NullPointerException	at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.fields.FixForVersion.getDefaultValue(FixForVersion.java:59)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.apache.velocity.util.introspection.UberspectImpl$VelMethodImpl.invoke(UberspectImpl.java:234)

+*Workaround*+
This is caused when the default issue type of the project's Issue Type Scheme is a sub-task type.
To avoid this error the default issue type should be a standard issue type.
fields.summary: New Card throws a NPE if the default issue type of the Issue type scheme is a sub-task

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Goto planning board.
2. Save the context with some search query.
3. Now click "edit context name" link and try to save a blank context name.

Result:
1. It take the blank context name without any error though, the context name revert to the last saved one.

Expected:
1. User should be given a warning message for trying to save empty context name.
fields.summary: User can edit context name with blank name, though not saved in JIRA

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Click New to create a new context.
2. First, the focus is no where. User need to set focus on context name.
3. Now After entering the name for context name, press enter.

Result:
1. The focus is there on context name text field.

Expected:
1. Tabbing should shift focus to next object in the UI
fields.summary: Pressing tab does nothing when focus is on "Context Name" text field.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Goto planning board and double click on any issue to view it in detail view.
2. From drop down menu select comment.
3. Click "Update" without entering any comment.

Result:
1. It proceed without any error message though the best part is no comment is saved for issue.

Expected:
1. User should get a proper warning message, blank comments can't be saved or we can disable update button till user enter some text.
fields.summary: User can save empty comments from GH, though they don't get save in JIRA issue

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Goto planning board.
2. Click on new card.
3. Without entering any summary click on "Create" or "create and close".

Result:
1. User gets an error message but focus is no where. 

Expected:
1. Great to have focus back on summary field.
fields.summary: As a GH user I would like the cursor focus to be in the text box (edition/creation)

fields.description:

1. Goto planning board and click on "New card"

Result:
1. The alignment of issue type drop down and priority is not same in IE. On FF 3.5 they appear fine.
2. The issue drop down seems to be of not same height width as priority.
fields.summary: Alignment of issue type and priority drop down is not correct in IE for new card dialog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login JIRA
2. Goto planning board and click to view the menu options under Tools or View.
3. Try to select any menu option by using keyboard, by using up and down arrow keys

Result:
1. Scrolling and clicking enter on any of the options in list doesn't select it.
2. Selecting options in JIRA for same type of drop down works with keyboard.

Expected:
1. User should be able to select options using keyboard.
fields.summary: User can't select items in View and Tools menu with keyboard.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. launch JIRA
2. open the Planning Board
3. select the Default context
4. select an existing context besides Default
5. create a new context
6. apply the new context

Observed:
Existing contexts no longer work. New ones filter correctly. 

Expected:
Existing contexts should work in the new version.
fields.summary: Selected Context is not applied when an existing context is used

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Goto planning board. I tested with project JIRA
2. Click on print icon for unscheduled. For some schedules it work also, so not sure what is causing the failure.

Result:
1. It fails with a long stack trace. log attached.

Expected.
1. It should work without any error.
fields.summary: Print is failing for Greenhopper sometimes when user click on print icon for schedules

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Goto planning board and click "new card"
2. Enter 171628738743974938w as value of original estimate. It give user error message "• Error occurred while storing issue.:  Failed to create Issue."
3. Try with value 17162873874397493w and click save and close.

Result:
1. GH tries to create issue and fail with error. Screenshot enclosed.
2. User can't access GH till, you he/she deletes issue from JIRA.

Expected:
1. Proper error handling should be there.
fields.summary: Trying to create new card with large orginal estimate stop GH from working

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to QA-JAC and click on "Agile" tab.
2. Select project as JIRA and in the board search input 4.0.
3. User has searched issues open in iframe. Click on subtask icon to create a subtask.

Result:
1. It fails. Error in firebug B is null
[Break on this error] var Prototype={Version:"1.5.1.1",Browser...r A=B.split("_");return A[A.length-1]}};

Expected:
1. User should be able to create subtask for the search issues.
fields.summary: Trying to create subtask inisde the iframe for searched issues is not working

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. User has Greenhopper installed and some data.
3. Try to restore data having no greenhopper license key or data.

Result:
1. On UI front no issues and restore works and user is ask to log in.
2. In logs there is stack trace. log enclosed.

Expected:
1. No Stack trace
fields.summary: Trying to restore JIRA data with greenhooper install leave stack trace in log file

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When you have an issue assigned to multiple fix versions and at least one of those versions is released, the background of the cards will have a large R or green tick (we changed the icon recently for 4.0). 

!released.jpg!

Its not really documented anywhere and its not immediately apparent what it means.
fields.summary: Document what the green ticks / large "R" on issues means

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Select Agile->Planning board.
3. Select "new" next to context.
4. Put spaces as context name and save.

Result:
1. It save without any error.

Expected:
1. Proper error message should be there. User should n't be allowed to save context name having only spaces
fields.summary: User can save a context with name having only spaces

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Click on project tab, it open with information for the currently selected project.
3. Click on "Agile" tab. Now from project drop down select some other project.
4. It work and user can see information about the currently selected project.
5. Try to access the project drop down again.

Result:
1. Nothing happens.

Expected:
1. User should be able to access project drop down without any issues.
fields.summary: All header drop down stop working if user is in "Agile" tab and selected a project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Start JIRA with Greenhopper plugin.
2. Restore the data in setup screen.
3. Goto Administration tab and click on "Greenhopper" link.

Result:
1. It fails with "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java/util/Date
	at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Class.java:2427)
	at java.lang.Class.privateGetPublicMethods(Class.java:2547)
	at java.lang.Class.getMethods(Class.java:1410)
 
2. Restart JIRA and try again it work without any error.

Expected:
1. User should be able to input license for GH without any issues.
fields.summary: Clicking on "Greenhopper" link in admin to enter license fails with stack trace

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great if we could expand the drag and drop feature to move tasks between stories to allow the automatic conversion of stories into tasks by dropping them onto another story. The conversion process in JIRA is cumbersome and too time consuming to be done in a scrum meeting.
fields.summary: Ability to convert a story to a task by dropping it onto another story

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The drag and drop feature to move tasks between stories on the Planning Board is great but where we really need it is on the Task Board.
fields.summary: Ability to drag and drop tasks between stories on the Task Board
